quiz.title: Unit 1: Quiz 1
quiz.subtitle: Grade 11 Kinematics - Motion Under Gravity & Projectiles
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: A ball is thrown vertically upward with speed $20 \, \text{m/s}$. How high does it rise? $(g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2)$
A stone is dropped from a cliff. It hits the ground after 4 seconds. What is the cliff's height? $(g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2)$
A projectile is launched at $30^\circ$ with speed $40 \, \text{m/s}$. What is its range? $(g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2)$
A ball thrown upward returns to thrower's hand after 6 seconds. What was initial speed? $(g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2)$
From same height, Ball A is dropped and Ball B is thrown horizontally at $10 \, \text{m/s}$. Which hits ground first?
questions.explanation: Vertical motion independent of horizontal. Both have same initial vertical velocity (0) and acceleration (g), so same time to fall.

questions.question: A projectile reaches max height of 45 m. What was vertical component of initial velocity? $(g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2)$
A ball is thrown at $37^\circ$ with speed $50 \, \text{m/s}$. What is time of flight? $(\sin 37^\circ = 0.6, \cos 37^\circ = 0.8, g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2)$
An object thrown upward passes a point at height 15 m twice: at t=1s and t=3s. What is initial speed? $(g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2)$
questions.explanation: Using $h = ut - \frac{1}{2}gt^2$: At t=1: $15 = u(1) - 5(1)^2$ → $u = 20$. At t=3: $15 = u(3) - 5(9)$ → $3u = 60$ → $u = 20$. Wait inconsistent. Let's solve: $15 = ut - 5t^2$ → $5t^2 - ut + 15 = 0$. Roots t=1,3 satisfy: sum $1+3 = u/5$ → $u = 20 \, \text{m/s}$.

questions.question: A basketball is shot at $45^\circ$ to just clear a 3 m high rim 6 m away. What is minimum speed needed? $(g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2)$
questions.explanation: At $45^\circ$, $u_x = u_y = u/\sqrt{2}$. Time to reach rim: $t = \frac{6}{u_x} = \frac{6\sqrt{2}}{u}$. Vertical: $3 = u_yt - 5t^2 = \frac{u}{\sqrt{2}} \cdot \frac{6\sqrt{2}}{u} - 5\left(\frac{6\sqrt{2}}{u}\right)^2$ → $3 = 6 - \frac{360}{u^2}$ → $u^2 = 120$ → $u = \sqrt{120} \, \text{m/s}$

questions.question: From top of 80 m tower, a ball is thrown horizontally at $15 \, \text{m/s}$. How far from base does it land? $(g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2)$
questions.explanation: Time to fall: $t = \sqrt{\frac{2h}{g}} = \sqrt{\frac{160}{10}} = \sqrt{16} = 4 \, \text{s}$. Horizontal distance: $x = v_x t = 15 \times 4 = 60 \, \text{m}$

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered projectile motion and free fall!
scoreMessages.70: Very good! Review time of flight and range formulas.
scoreMessages.50: Good effort! Practice separating horizontal and vertical motions.
scoreMessages.0: Review kinematic equations and projectile motion basics.
